summary.para: Get a constant buffer by index.

returns.para: A pointer to a constant buffer (see ).

remarks.para: A constant buffer supplies either scalar constants or texture constants to a shader. A shader can use one or more constant buffers. For best performance, separate constants into buffers based on the frequency they are updated.

summary.para: Get a constant buffer by name.

returns.para: A pointer to a constant buffer (see ).

remarks.para: A constant buffer supplies either scalar constants or texture constants to a shader. A shader can use one or more constant buffers. For best performance, separate constants into buffers based on the frequency they are updated.

summary.para: Get an input-parameter description for a shader.

param.name: pDesc
param.para: A pointer to a shader-input-signature description. See .

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: An input-parameter description is also called a shader signature. The shader signature contains information about the input parameters such as the order or parameters, their data type, and a parameter semantic.

summary.para: Get an output-parameter description for a shader.

param.name: pDesc
param.para: A pointer to a shader-output-parameter description. See .

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: An output-parameter description is also called a shader signature. The shader signature contains information about the output parameters such as the order or parameters, their data type, and a parameter semantic.

summary.para: Get a description of the resources bound to a shader.

param.name: pDesc
param.para: A pointer to an input-binding description. See .

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: A shader consists of executable code (the compiled HLSL functions) and a set of resources that supply the shader with input data. This API gets a list of the resources that are bound as inputs to the shader.

summary.para: A shader-reflection interface accesses shader information.

remarks.para: Create the interface by calling D3DX10ReflectShader. Since it is a COM interface, creating the interface increases a reference count and the interface must be released when it is no longer needed. The remaining shader-reflection interfaces are not COM interfaces.
